decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (067-AO-205, Rev A, dated 09.06.2013, received 09/06/2014; 067-AO-204, Rev B, dated 09.06.2013, received 11/06/2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times [08.00-22.00 Mon-Sat, 10.00-22.00 Sun & Bank Holidays].

Condition : 4 - The use shall not commence until a scheme for control of fumes and odours including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing.

Condition : 5 - The on-site refuse storage and collection facilities referred to in the approved drawings and supporting documents as part of this permission including the associated secure storage area shall be provided before the development is first brought into use.  The facilities shall be made permanently available and no waste shall be stored outside the provided bin or bins within the site or other than in the designated area.  Non-recyclable and perishable waste shall be removed from site no less frequently than once a week.  Waste shall be removed as soon as the bins become full if this is earlier than the time of the normal collection.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the details given in the drawings hereby approved, the refuse store shall be constructed from yellow London Stock Brickwork to match the rear elevation of the building with a brick on edge parapet with a red tile crease all round and a black rainwater downpipe and hopper for drainage.  The doors shall be varnished dark brown or painted black or dark green in a tongue and groove timber external finish.
description: Change of use at ground and first floor from existing A1 retail to proposed A3 cafe and restaurant with alterations to the shop front and construction of a refuse store on the north elevation.
